```{r setup, include = FALSE}

  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)

library(quantmod)

getSymbols("GS") #Goldman Sachs
GS <- as.data.frame(GS)
GS$date <- row.names(GS)
```

Below are the standard chart types (exlcluding webGL).

* Bar
* Line
* Area
* Step
* Scatter
* Effect Scatter
* Candlestick
* Funnel
* Sankey
* Graph
* Heatmap
* Parallel
* Pie
* Tree
* Treemap
* River (streamgraph)
* Sunburst
* Boxplot
* Calendar
* Gauge
* Polar 
* wordcloud 
* liquidFill 
* Choropleth
* Map

### Line and Area

```{r}
library(echarts4r)

df <- data.frame(
  x = seq(50),
  y = rnorm(50, 10, 3),
  z = rnorm(50, 11, 2),
  w = rnorm(50, 9, 2)
)

df %>% 
  e_charts(x) %>% 
  e_line(z) %>% 
  e_area(w) %>% 
  e_title("Line and area charts")
```

### Bar and step

```{r}
df %>% 
  e_charts(x) %>% 
  e_bar(y, name = "Serie 1") %>% 
  e_step(z, name = "Serie 2") %>% 
  e_title("Bar and step charts")
```

### Scatter

```{r}
df %>% 
  e_charts(x) %>% 
  e_scatter(y, z) %>% 
  e_visual_map(min = 4, max = 17) %>% # scale color
  e_legend(FALSE) # hide legend
```

### Candlestick

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(quantmod)

getSymbols("GS") #Goldman Sachs
GS <- as.data.frame(GS)
GS$date <- row.names(GS)
```

```{r}
GS %>% 
  e_charts(date) %>% 
  e_candle(GS.Open, GS.Close, GS.Low, GS.High, name = "Goldman Sachs") %>% 
  e_datazoom(type = "slider")
```
